issues.description: Type mismatch for Person.birthday across artifacts: the problem statement and the template use java.time.LocalDate for Person.birthday, but the solution repository's common Person class declares birthday as String. This also creates an internal inconsistency inside the solution repository: client UI code (PersonScene) expects Person.getBirthday() to return a LocalDate (passes it to a DatePicker), but the solution's Person model returns a String. This will cause compilation/runtime errors and confuse students comparing template and solution.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the Person.birthday type consistent across all artifacts. Preferably change the solution repository's common Person.birthday from String back to java.time.LocalDate (matching the problem statement and template). Update imports in solution_repository/src/common/java/de/tum/in/ase/eist/model/Person.java to import java.time.LocalDate and change getter/setter signatures accordingly. Verify and, if necessary, adjust any code in the solution that assumed String (e.g., serialization/deserialization or UI code) so the client PersonScene and server/service code compile and operate correctly.
